page.title: 09DOVECOTS
page.content: Fife has long been remarkable for the number of its dovecots. By the end of the eighteenth century there were 360 in the county. Many dovecots in Fife were demolished within recent years, yet no fewer than 93 have been recorded. There are two rectangular dovecots on the north side of Boarhills standing within 70 yards of each other.The western one measuring 13 feet 5 inches by 13 feet 10 inches is in ruinous condition while the eastern one measuring 14 feet 10 inches by 14 feet 6 inches is entire.They are built of rubble and are harled.The flanks are crow_stepped,the back wall is higher than the front,and there is a lean_to roof of timber. They probably date from the seventeenth century.
